maml:description.maml:para: Get EBS volumes that are unattached to an EC2 instance
This function returns a list of custom objects with properties from AWS EBS volume objects where each EBS volume is available (unattached).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AvailableEBS | Group -Property Account | Select Name, Count

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get available EBS volumes, group them by Account, then show each Account name and number of volumes

maml:description.maml:para: Get price data from AWS for EC2 instances
This function retrieves the EC2 price data for AWS us-east-1 region and returns a CSV file with the relevant data.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get price data for instances in the us-west-2 (California) region

maml:description.maml:para: Get EC2 instances from multiple AWS accounts
This function returns a list of the EC2 instances in production or in all available AWS credential profiles.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all EC2 instances and store them in an array $All

maml:description.maml:para: This function will return a list of AWS Elastic Load Balancers based on the Region and credentials (ProfileName) provided it. Not all properties are included and a few custom properties, namely IPAddress, has been added.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all ELBs from the AWS account represented in the credential profile MyAccount.

maml:description.maml:para: Create an IAM report from AWS data
This function will use the supplied AWS Credential profile to generate and parse the IAM Credential Report. It then returns the account information.

command:parameter.aliases: Data, CredentialReport, File, FilePath, Report, ReportPath
command:parameter.maml:name: Path

command:parameter.aliases: Data, CredentialReport, File, FilePath, Report, ReportPath
command:parameter.maml:name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generate report for account represented by credential profile MyAccount

maml:description.maml:para: Get list of EC2 instances in given account
This function queries AWS EC2 API for all instances in a given region for a given account. It requires an AWS Credential Profile and uses a custom class to store the data.

maml:Description.maml:para: AWS Profile containing access key and secret
AWS Profile containing access key and secret

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all EC2 instances in given region for account represented by given credential profile

maml:description.maml:para: Get AWS networking infrastructure information for a VPC
This function iterates through the networking infrastructure (VPC's, Subnets, and Route Tables) and outputs a list of objects using the Route Tables as a connection point.

maml:Description.maml:para: AWS Profile containing key and secret
AWS Profile containing key and secret

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get network infrastructure info for VPC "vpc-12345678"

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve security group information from an AWS VPC
This function retrieves all security groups from the provided VPC and outputs an object with a subset of the data, including the EC2 instances, in a format easy to use.

maml:Description.maml:para: AWS Profile containing key and secret
AWS Profile containing key and secret

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all Security Groups in VPC vpc-12345678 and store the info in variable $a

maml:description.maml:para: Generate reports for instances offline and running without reservation

This script iterates through all instances in a give AWS Region and creates a list of specific attributes. It then finds the last stop time, user who stopped the instance, and calculates the number of days the system has been stopped (if possible) and creates a data sheet (CSV). The data sheet is then imported into Excel and formatted. This can be done for a single or multiple accounts based on AWS Credentail Profiles.

maml:Description.maml:para: AWS Credential Profie with key and secret
AWS Credential Profie with key and secret

dev:remarks.maml:para: Generate new EC2 report for account represented by credential profile MyAccountName in us-west-1 region
